options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: n/a

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I improved as a performer, became better at giving and receiving feedback, and built up my musical theater repertoire.

Week to week, I learned key insights into myself as a performer and general theatermaker. I also learned about the history of musical theater (producers, writers, directors, etc.) through the readings.
This course helped me develop a checklist of things I'm looking for when I observe a performance (the intention behind the repetition of a given lyric, physical gestures, etc).

Robust understanding of History of Nusical theater as we know it today. Roughly focuses on the past 150 years of material. 
Work focusing on how to Pproach a song as a performer, combination Acting and Musical Theater History Course
I developed my performance skills, specifically in a musical theater setting.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: So many chances for 1 on 1 time with Professor Jolles. You get to perform a lot and receive feedback from your peers!
Weaknesses: None!
The course's biggest asset is Professor Jolles's feedback and the certainty with which she gives it. Her expertise makes the class worth taking.
Strengths: Professor Annette Jolles. She made this course. I doubt this course would function in a digital format, but she made it work!
I was surprised by how effective the seminar setting was over Zoom. We managed to get a lot of performance and critique during class, which was very engaging.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: There were some technical difficulties in video taping our performances and having to sing in our residential colleges without disturbing suitemates. Overall, however, we made it work, and it was a very fun time.
It's really hard to do a performance class over Zoom. I thought Professor Jolles did the best she could in facilitating a performing environment over Zoom.
The challenges of live performance were countered with a system where students uploaded performances to Dropbox, which worked well.
Digital submission of tapes worked well. But I wish we had more Live-work back and forth. Things were difficult the first half of the semester as we all figured out the tech.
The seminar format with a small class size was extremely effective!

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I would highly recommend this course if you are passionate about musical theater and performing.

Absolutely! Every performer at Yale should take a class with Annette Jolles. Whether or not you want to go into the theater business, Annette is one of the most brilliant directors I've ever worked with. You will learn so much about yourself!
Yes! If you're interested in performance or directing, either casually or professionally, this course will be fun and helpful.

Yes! This is a great course for a performer to exercise the musical performance muscle. Lots of the material is self guided, so make sure you find material that is enjoyable to work and make you excited for class.
Yes, I would recommend this course for students looking to grow in their performance confidence and students who are eager to learn more of the musical theater repertoire.
Absolutely! It was so much fun to take, but it was also extremely challenging. I learned to grow not just as a performer but also as an audience member.
